intro: Cischweinfia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated cissus, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Cischweinfia rostrata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
